titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 279: Crestomazia di poeti italiani del Cinquecento.

notesStmt.note: Spine title: Bembo. Sonetti e poesie di vari autori.

Nine sonetti of Bembo -- Eight stanzas by an anonymous author -- One long canzone of nine stanzas by an anonymous author (inc.: Quando 'l di parte, & l'ombra il mondo cuopre) -- "Motti" of Bembo in 312 hendecasyllables, rhymed in couplets -- A short canzone of Giovanni Guidiccioni -- Four sonetti of Bernardo (or Bernardino) Capello, addressed to Re[verendissi]mo Farnese and Mons. Della Casa --Three sonetti of Molza -- One sonetto of Bernardo Daniello -- One sonetto of Ugolino Martegli, addressed to Benedetto Varchi -- One sonetto by an anonymous poet -- Nine stanzas by Claudio Tolomei -- One sonetto of Mons. Della Casa -- One canzone in six stanzas by Bembo (inc.: Donna de' cui begl'occhi alto diletto) -- One sonetto of Ugolino Martegli, addressed to Antonio Berardi.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Anthology of 16th-century Italian poetry. Contains nine sonnets, one canzone and "motti" by Pietro Bembo; poems by Giovanni Guidiccioni, B. Capello, F. Molza, B. Daniello, U. Martegli, C. Tolomei, and Della Casa (possibly Giovanni Della Casa); and several anonymous poems.

msItem.title: Crestomazia di poeti italiani del Cinquecento.

supportDesc.extent: 30 leaves : 203 x 147 (153 x 88) mm bound to 208 x 149 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (18th-century[?] paper) + 30 + i (18th-century[?] paper); 1-15, 15-59; contemporary pagination in ink, upper outer corners.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a humanistic script by a single hand. The few corrections (e.g., p. 4) might be in the same hand or a similar second hand.

binding.p: 18th-century[?] half-leather, with marbled paper over boards. Spine label has a gold crown with the letters "F. S.", probably indicating Libreria F. Strozzi. Some leaves stained. A few leaves show signs of repairs to the corners. Cover wearing at edges; wearing and beginning to split at outside hinges.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Libreria Strozzi (gilt stamp, spine).
